bill_title: provide for the practice of cosmetology services in certain venues outside of a licensed salon.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the practice of cosmetology services in certain venues outside of a licensed salon. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 36-15-54 be amended to read as follows: 36-15-54. Cosmetology, nail technology, and esthetics may only be practiced in a licensed salon or booth, except as provided in this section. A demonstrator, while demonstrating under the provisions of this chapter may practice cosmetology for compensation, fee, or any other remuneration outside of the premises of a licensed salon. In addition, a licensee may practice cosmetology services on persons unable to come to the salon because of imprisonment, disabling sickness, or other disability as long as the licensee documents the service through a salon or booth. A licensed nursing facility that permits cosmetology services only to its residents and does not advertise as a salon is not required to have a salon license. A licensee may practice cosmetology, nail technology, and esthetic services at a customer's private residence, place of business, hotel or motel room, or other venue the customer keeps, maintains, or controls if the licensee maintains, at a licensed salon, a complete record of any such services provided including the date, time, and place the services were performed and the fee charged.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
